page.description: Find an argument in the collection.
page.original:
SQL::Arguments::Find() Syntax as P = .Find( Argument_Name as C ) ArgumentDescription A dot variable containing the Data, Name, and Usage properties of the object. A SQL::Arguments object. Argument_NameThe name property of the argument as defined by SQL::Arguments.Add() or SQL::Argument.Set().
Description The .Find() method returns information about a defined argument. Examples dim args as SQL::Arguments args.add("city", "Boston") args.add("state", "MA") ? args.Find("state") = Data = "MA" Name = "state" Usage = 0 ? args.Find("state").data = "MA"
See Also SQL::Arguments Object Limitations
